headline: While Oilfield Firms Eye Venezuela Return, One is Already There Drilling Wells
summary: While big oilfield services companies including Halliburton and SLB await the green light to ramp back up in Venezuela, one of their rivals already has rigs running in the country.  Ensign Energy Services, with headquarters in Calgary, Alberta, and operations around the world, has had two rigs drilling in Venezuela since autumn, the latest in an on-again-off-again past several years there for the firm.  "We've stuck it out," Robert Geddes, president and chief operating officer, said in an interview.

headline: Halliburton Q4 Earnings Preview: Will Cost Cuts Drive a Beat?
summary: HAL's Q4 results may get a lift from cost cuts and margin gains, even as revenues face year-over-year pressure.

headline: Curious about Halliburton (HAL) Q4 Performance? Explore Wall Street Estimates for Key Metrics
summary: Evaluate the expected performance of Halliburton (HAL) for the quarter ended December 2025, looking beyond the conventional Wall Street top-and-bottom-line estimates and examining some of its key metrics for better insight.

headline: ORA Inks Long-Term PPA to Deliver Carbon-Free Geothermal Power
summary: Ormat Technologies signs a 20-year PPA with Switch to supply carbon-free geothermal power to data centers, marking its first direct deal.
